title: Crowell Comfortable with Young Goaltending
text:
Crowell Comfortable with Young Goaltending 
By Zach Schneider October 20, 2015 Updated Oct 20, 2015 at 6:39 PM CDT 
Duluth, MN (NNCNOW.com) --- Maddie Rooney had a couple firsts this past weekend for the University of Minnesota Duluth (UMD) women's hockey team, and first-year head coach Maura Crowell seems comfortable in letting the freshman goaltender try to add to that early in her career. 
Rooney earned her first collegiate win this past Friday over MSU-Mankato, and then she earned her first collegiate shutout the next night against the same team. 
Having split time with senior Kayla Black, Rooney is currently (2-2-0) this season with a 1.50 goals against average. 
Crowell, for one, seems confident when Rooney is between the pipes. 
"I think she's an ice in the veins type of goalie," Crowell said. "She doesn't get phased by much. She's in position, she's confident, and she plays big. I think the key to her game is confidence and her technical ability." 
UMD is (4-4-0) overall this season and this weekend will visit in-state rival and top-ranked Minnesota.
